title: Facilities Map
content:
[[iftags +fragment]]

**Note**: the map below (and nothing else on this page) can be included on any page that doesn't have the fragment tag, using the following code:
[[div class="code"]]
@<[[include :scp-wiki:fragment:facilities-map>@
legend = Legend|
site = Site|
area = Area
]]
[[/div]]
You can replace Legend, Site and Area with terms of your choice, enabling you to translate this map into other languages without having to copy the whole thing over every time it gets updated!

This page was designed to be collaborative, so if you add a Site to the [[[Secure Facilities Locations]]] page and it has a well defined location, you can also add to this map. Feel free to make minor edits to positioning of the icons if you think the position is off, just preview carefully before saving. 

Please also add new sites to the [[[fragment:facilities-map-int| International Facilities Map]]], which contains all of these Facilities as well as Facilities from other branches of the SCP Foundation. The locations should be exactly the same, although it does have some extra pop-out maps for Europe and Asia.

A few notes;
* Don't add facilities like Site-01 or Site-19 just because one article specifies a location - unlike the facilities on this map, those Sites don't have a consistently agreed upon location! 
* Many of these locations are approximate - often, only the State or Country has been specified in published articles, so the location within it was basically a guess.
* These locations aren't "canon", just widely agreed on. You're free to contradict this map in your own articles if you feel like it!

[[collapsible show="▷ Instructions for Additions" hide="◁ With and without a custom icon"]]
Copy and edit the following code, replacing x_coordinate and y_coordinate with numbers (representing distance from the top left corner in percent) and replacing url_for_the_image with the image link for the Site or Area icon:
[[div class="code"]]
@<[[include :scp-wiki:component:mapping-source>@
facility=-- |
x=x_coordinate |
y=y_coordinate |
image=url_for_the_image|>@
]]
[[/div]]

If you don't have a custom image for your Site or Area, you can use a plain white outline, replacing XXX with your number (for an area, use template-area)
[[div class="code"]]
@<[[include :scp-wiki:component:mapping-source>@
facility=-- |
x=x_coordinate |
y=y_coordinate |
image=https://scp-wiki.wdfiles.com/local--files/fragment%3Afacilities-map/template-site.png|
textclass=numbermap |
text=XXX |
]]
[[/div]]

For full instructions on how to use this component, see the [[[component:mapping|Mapping Component Page]]].

Timesaving Tip: When adding new facilities, copy the x and y coordinates from the nearest site or area, then make small adjustments until your icon is in the correct position!

New additions should be added in numerical order to the appropriate list of Sites or Areas. Facilities in North America are listed twice, the first time to add them to the North American Map, the second time to add them to the World Map. Facilities in Europe are also listed twice, on both the Europe map and the World Map.
[[/collapsible]]

In addition to including this page on any other page, you're welcome to copy the code and use it for any other purpose compatible with the license - feel free to add or remove Facilities, change icons, or add additional popouts for other regions to show specific locations in more detail. Just make sure to credit [[*user Jerden]], [[*user L200]], and any artists who's work you use - you'll need to copy the licensing information at the bottom of this page over to your page.

[[=]]
+ Map of Foundation Facilities
++ (Major Facilities of the English-Speaking Foundation)
[[/=]]
[[/iftags]]

[[include :scp-wiki:component:mapping-source
code=-- |
]]

[[module CSS]]
.special41 {
   position: absolute;
   height: 1.5vmin;
   width: 1.5vmin;
   background-size: contain !important;
   background-repeat: no-repeat;
   transform: translate(-50%, -50%);
   opacity: 0.25;
   transition: all 0.3s;
}

.special41:hover {
   transform: translate(-50%, -50%) scale(7.5);
   opacity: 1;
   z-index: 2;
}
[[/module]]
